Description: Shoulder fragment with turn to neck of East Greek black-figured pottery closed vase, probably oenochoe; probably slipped on exterior. Part of the necking fillet preserved; tongues at top of shoulder; in frieze below, a boar to right, all but its head and left foreleg preserved; incised rosettes in the field; red for the third tongue from the right, on the boar's belly and left hind leg, and in the field at left. A black vertical band is modern.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 10, no. 28 pl. 7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.981)
